techmeme.title: The RIAA amends its lawsuit against Suno, now accusing it of unlawfully "stream ripping" songs on YouTube and violating the DMCA (Jess Weatherbed/The Verge)
A White House official says the US will not hold a golden share or equity in TikTok US and the new board will not have a member selected by the US government (Bloomberg)
AppZen, which builds AI-powered tools to automate finance functions, raised a $180M Series D led by Riverwood Capital, bringing its total funding to $290M (Mary Ann Azevedo/Crunchbase News)
The $100K+ H-1B fee could accelerate offshoring as tech companies route work to India and other countries rather than bringing engineers to the US (Manish Singh/India Dispatch)
Sources: smart ring maker Oura is raising an $875M+ Series E at a $10.9B valuation, up from $5B in November 2024, and has sold ~3M rings over the past year (Bloomberg)
